intro: Howardia veraguensis, commonly known as the velvetleaf or false hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant has thick, waxy leaves that give it a velvety appearance, and it often grows in moist, tropical environments. It is often used in ornamental gardening due to its striking blooms and adaptability. Howardia veraguensis is also known for its ability to thrive in partial shade, making it a versatile choice for gardeners.
